An 'erg' is the unit of energy and mechanical work in the centimetre-gram-second
(CGS) system of units, symbol "erg". Its name is derived from the Greek ergon,
meaning "work". Oxford English Dictionary

An erg is the amount of work done by a force of one dyne exerted for a distance
of one centimeter. In the CGS base units, it is equal to one gram centimeter-
squared per second-squared (gÂ·cm 2/s 2). It is thus equal to
10 â7 joules or 100 nanojoules (nJ) in SI units.
